page.title: 09FARMING - HIGHAMS FARM
page.content: The farmhouse was built around 1400 by Thomas Higham. The farm was owned by the Higham family for nealy 600 years. Around 1900 the Bunting family bought the farm. A long long time ago the barges used to sail down the river and deliver the grain into a cart which is drawn by a horse. The farm has two tractors, two combine harvesters and one rape cutter. Mr.Bunting has eight fields all together. The farmhouse is in the middle of the farm. You can see Osea Island if you walk near the end of the farm. In the eight fields we found out that the farm grows:- 1.92 H. Rough Grass. 75.1 H. Barley. 8.7 H. Fruit. 11.2 H. Cockstoot. 1.2 H. Veg. Seeds. 23.4 H. Oil Seed Rape. 153.90 H. is 3.5 H. Vegetables. the total crop. 75.1 H. Wheat. 6.74 H. Saltings,roads. 14.1 H. Ryegrass. Total area 162.56 H.
